title: Capitals' Alex Ovechkin calls out Maple Leafs: Change your ways if you want to win
text:
CLOSE

Washington Capitals captain Alex Ovechkin, who became a more complete player as he won the Stanley Cup in 2018, says the Toronto Maple Leafs have to do the same if they want to win it all.

"I think for them, they are still a young group of guys and I hope they’re going to learn," Ovechkin told reporters at the morning skate prior to tonight's game. "It’s up to them how they want to do it and if they want to play for yourself, or if they want to win a Cup, they have to play differently."

Ovechkin knows of which he speaks. He was criticized throughout his career for not caring enough about the team, specifically his defensive responsibilities. When Barry Trotz became the Capitals' coach in 2014, he asked Ovechkin to round out his game. In the Capitals' march to the Cup, Ovechkin's all-round play was noticeably improved.

Ovi says the Leafs need to 'figure out if they're playing for themselves or for a Stanley Cup' and if they want to win they need to play differently 👀 pic.twitter.com/oWTV5qUfmn — Yahoo Sports Canada (@YahooCASports) October 29, 2019

Most of the fans in hockey-crazed Toronto would agree with Ovechkin's assessment. The team's shaky defensive game has undermined the team's efforts to become a top contender. Their 6-5-2 start has been underwhelming to average.

In the early going, the Maple Leafs rank sixth in scoring 3.54 goals per game. But despite changing up their defense in the offseason, the Maple Leafs rank 24th at 3.38 goals given up per game. They are not hard enough to play against.

The Maple Leafs would indeed be better off if they heeded Ovechkin's advice.
description: Alex Ovechkin told reporters in Toronto that the Maple Leafs need to change their ways if they want to win a Stanley Cup. Ovi would know.
